name: EAHPMedicineHandlingAutomationTypes
title: EAHP Medicine Handling Automation Types
description: CodeSystem defining specific types of medicine handling automation for EAHP interoperability.

concept.definition: An automation system handling whole packs, often located in central pharmacies for high-volume storage and retrieval.
A decentralized automation unit used to supply unit doses or whole packs, typically located in wards, ICUs, or near surgery rooms.
An automation system that de-blisters or takes bulk items, singularizes them, and packages them (e.g., into rings or strips) for patient-specific administration.
A robot designed to automatically prepare compound medications, such as IV therapy bags or chemotherapy.
A mobile cart equipped with electronic locking or tracking to store and transport patient-specific administrations.
